paper.title: Updates with Equality: Beyond the Herbrand Universe Assumption
paper.venue: International Syposium on Methodologies for Intelligent Systems
paper.abstract: Model-based update semantics appear promising as a definition for the meaning of updates to logical databases and knowledge bases. The proposals for these semantics to date, however, do not fully support updates involving equality; for example, given a knowledge base containing ‘Destination(Galileo)=Venus’, inserting the new fact ‘Destination(Galileo)=Jupiter’ will produce inconsistency. This paper extends model-based update semantics to support updates involving equality, by permitting changes in both universe composition and in function interpretations in the models being updated. We present both a semantics based on the traditional measures of distance between models, and a new measure that evaluates the similarity between pairs of models on the basis of the presence and/or absence of homomorphisms between them.
